bibl.title: Fang v. Yuk. Cover
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 2nd Judicial of Washington Territory

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Thurston }Ss
In the Justice Court Before W.T. Keady Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington vs Sam Hung }ss

To any constable or sheriff and the keeper of the County jail of said county whereas at Committee of Magistrates court held in my office in said cit for the examination of Sam
Hung for the offense hereinafter stated the said Sam Hung was by me found to having on the 20th day of April 1885 in said city and court committed the offense of embezzlement in this tha said Sam Hung did on said day at the County and Territory aforesaid fraudulently and unlawfully exhibit embezzle, convert to this concurse and commit larceny of the sum of 60 05 cents the property of one Kong Mck then and thereentrusted to said Sam Hung for purpose for him by Sam Hung and upon conviction the said laws did adjudge and determine that said Sam Hung should enter into recognizance in the sum of $500 to be and appear before
the grand jury at the June 1885 term of the District Court at Olympia and to stand committed to the county jail until a good and sufficient bond should be furnished such appear and therefore you the said constable or sheriff are commanded in the name of the Territory of Washington for the to convey and deliver the said Sam Hung to the said Keeper and you the Keeper are hereby commanded the said Sam Hung in to your custody into said jail and him safely keep until the terms of said judgmenet are complied with or until he shall there be discharged by due course of law as provided by the statutes of said Territory.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be issued directed to said William Billings commanding him to have the body of your petitioner before your honor at the time and place to be therein specified to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning said charge together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ and that petitioner may be restored to his liberty
Territory of Washington, County of Thurston}SS

Sam Hung of said county being duly sworn in his oath says that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition that
he has heard the said petition read and knows the contents thereof and that he believes that said petition is true
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 23rd day of April 1885
